I‚Äôve stayed in a hostel once before, and this one is nothing like what I imagined a hostel to be. The place is wonderfully cozy, warm, and has a homey feel. The location is excellent, the pods are comfortable, place is squeaky clean and the staff is amazing.
On top of that, they even offer breakfast and really great coffee for guests. For the price and location, it‚Äôs unbeatable. I would definitely stay here again!
Response from Alex & Zinaida
3 days ago
Thanks for staying with us Klaudia. We're glad you enjoyed your time here with us. You're welcome back anytime you're in NYC!

The people in the photo (hosts) are not the people I ever saw at this location and don't seem to be on site. It was as described, and you should know that it is run by Hare Krishna. They are doing great work and offer simple meals at any time of the day to anyone staying. Everything was clean, and all of the hosts were friendly! I would stay here again!
Response from Alex & Zinaida
3 weeks ago
Thanks for staying with us Carolyn. Sorry you missed meeting Alex (from the picture) but he only does the early morning shift. We're really happy you enjoyed your time with us and hope to see you again the next time you're in NYC!

The location is an easy walk from penn station, the staff is kind, and the place feels safe. Inside, it is clean, welcoming, and warm with snacks and coffee. The only issue I had were the late arrivals, 11 pm or 12 am, keeping me awake when I had to work in the morning. Otherwise, it's is great for a solo trip!

Laura
Berlin, Germany
Rating, 2 stars
,
¬∑
1 day ago
,
¬∑
Stayed one night
My husband stayed here for one night and then had to leave it was so bad. Hugely misrepresented in the airbnb photos and reviews. The cubicles were like cells. It was horribly loud, you could hear literally everything. He said he heard talking, snoring, and farting well into the night and even with earplugs he couldn't sleep. Bodily functions don't obey quiet hours. The hosts were kind and it was clean but this is bare bones. Is it really so expensive to put up some real walls? At least old school hostels used to have actual rooms.
Response from Alex & Zinaida
Today
Thanks for your feedback, Laura. We're glad your husband liked our vibe and cleanliness. You're right - this is a basic place, but it's safe, peaceful, centrally located, and about as quiet as this type of accommodation can be in NYC.
We're sorry if some of the details in the description were overlooked. That can sometimes happen when a reservation is made on someone's else's behalf. We appreciate your patience and apologize for any inconvenience your husband may have experienced.
With gratitude,
Alex

Rating, 3 stars
,
¬∑
2 days ago
,
¬∑
Stayed a few nights
The staff is great, the room is clean, and the overall atmosphere is cozy. The team was very attentive and strongly emphasized the importance of keeping quiet. During the night, I understood why.
Since the cubicles are not closed at the top, you can hear absolutely everything other guests do during the night. For me, this was unbearable, and I had to cancel my reservation the following day.
I only recommend this place if you are a very heavy sleeper.
Response from Alex & Zinaida
2 days ago
Thanks for staying with us Raquel. We're glad you enjoyed the staff and the cleanliness of the place. We're sorry it wasn't the right fit for you. Wishing you all the best!

This place was fantastic for the budget. I couldn‚Äôt ask for more. The daily free breakfast of bread, milk, and fresh fruits basically pays for itself to a certain extent. The room is small so it‚Äôs perfect for people that just need a place to sleep. But one thing to note is that you can‚Äôt bring any meat product in the building - which includes eggs and any canned food. It was a challenge for me to find affordable high quality protein for myself that needs to be eaten outside, so keep this in mind.

Booked for 4 day 3 nights, but couldn't stay there after the first night and checked myself into a hotel. 
Everyone around you is snoring; and they employ a Chinese lady at night to keep watch and wake up snorers - but you can't sleep either way. 
25 cubicles with beds 3/4 size of a single bed, and only 3 bathrooms and showers, walking around in circles to get there. 
If you're on a tight budget this might be for you, but if you have some standards book yourself a hotel.
Response from Alex & Zinaida
November 2025
Thanks, Christopher! We appreciate your stay and feedback. Our place is simple and budget-friendly, and while it may not be ideal for everyone, we do our best to keep it accurately described through our photos, property details and guest reviews over the past 9 years of hosting here.
One small request: we‚Äôd be grateful if you could reconsider mentioning the nationality of our staff in your review. Our interfaith team is professional, friendly, and dedicated to making guests feel welcome. Once again, we apologize for any inconvenience during your stay and truly appreciate you choosing us.
With gratitude,
Alex

Dan
Tampa, Florida
Rating, 3 stars
,
¬∑
4 weeks ago
,
¬∑
Stayed a few nights
PROS: Location is top notch. The staff is VERY friendly. Shared bathrooms/showers very clean. Water machine broke one day and was immediately worked on and fixed. The staff is great. Love that they offer drinks and small snacks at all hours. Staff member there at all times.
CONS: It is small- so do you research and check measurements- I'm 5'9 and the bed was too small for me. I hit my head twice in the bathroom- but again they do list measurements in listing so just make sure room would work for you.
My biggest complaint is the noise. They do their best- but there are snorers. You will hear MULTIPLE alarms going off all before 7am (some being hit on snooze or just left on for minutes at a time) and even though they have "quiet hours" there will phone calls/facetimes all around you. The best sleep I got was midday- but my sleep was severely affected unfortunately by other tenants. So it's the roll of the dice and hope you get decent people with manners.
Besides the noise- great stay.
Response from Alex & Zinaida
3 weeks ago
Thanks for staying with us Dan. We're glad you enjoyed the staff and location. Sorry about the noise, unfortunately with so many people sharing a space it only takes one or more bad bananas to ruin the bunch. Hopefully we will see you again the next time you're in NYC!

Netherlands
Rating, 5 stars
,
¬∑
January 2026
,
¬∑
Stayed a few nights
Great solution if you want to stay for a few nights in Manhattan on a budget! Perfect location, quite clean, friendly staff available 24/7, breakfast included.
The ceiling of the cubicle is open, so you'll get the snores (and smell) of your neighbors, but it's clearly communicated in advance. I stayed 6 nights; during two nights the staff woke up others to stop them from snoring, and one night  the police even came because someone didn't collaborate. The staff handled everything very well though and I never felt unsafe, but even with earplugs I found it sometimes difficult to sleep. 
Lastly, Im 6'3" (190 cm), and didn't fit flat on the bed as it was a bit short. Luckily I'm a side sleeper!
Would definitely recommend and come back as well! Thanks a lot!
Response from Alex & Zinaida
January 2026
Thanks for staying with us Peter. We're glad you enjoyed your time with us and hope to see you again the next time you're in NYC!

This place is budget-friendly, and has a walkable distance to great restaurants and metro stations. The hosts are easy to communicate with; the staffs are professional and available 24/7; the restroom is surprisingly clean with spotless toilets. 
As mentioned in the description, the rooms are not soundproof. I appreciate the hosts for being upfront on this issue, and for their efforts in maintaining the quietness, such as having the quiet hour from 8pm-8am, and providing the earplugs. However, there are about 10--20 guests, so it is hard to make sure that everyone stays quiet throughout the night. I am kind of a light sleeper, but I am on budget, so I tried this place; I turn out to be ok with staying for one night, but two nights or anytime longer starts to be difficult for me.

January 2026

As it's in a central busy location with Times  Square's constant bright lights, I always felt safe walking back by myself even at 2am. There is always a security guard at the front door too.
This is a no frills not super fancy place, but is excellent for a reliable clean room, unbeatable location, safe area for solo traveler, and quiet sleep. Lobby staff were great and friendly.  
You're paying for location here to maximize time spent out in NYC, not a luxurious hotel stay.

I have given this hotel one star because of being charged twice for taxes. The hotel itself was good, great area, quite for location, clean bathroom so no complaints there. Negatives were common areas etc need refurbishment but this is of reflected in the price paid. Only 3 elevators for 36 floors and one was out for the whole 8 nights of our stay. Wait times were ok but can be extended in busy periods. Staff were friendly and room serviced daily by a lovely lady. 
My issue is all taxes and charges were paid to Airbnb except for the destination charge which was to be paid to the hotel. As checkout was busy express checkout was suggested with the invoice emailed. Upon receipt I had been charged the destination charge plus local taxes that had already been paid. No amount of phone calls to the hotel or Airbnb has reversed this mistake of US$308. Clearly both companies have no idea what their process is. Other reviews seems to replicate my experience. Don‚Äôt book on Airbnb is my advice.

Response from Lotus
January 2026
Thank you, Jukka, for your feedback and for noting my friendliness as a host.
Regarding the hot water, I was not aware of the issue until it was reported during your stay. Once notified, the building superintendent addressed the water heater and the issue was resolved. Airbnb reviewed the situation and processed a refund in accordance with their policy.
I live in the home and cook regularly, so the kitchen is an actively used, lived-in space. It is kept clean and fully functional, and it is equipped for guests for light cooking, including a gas stove and microwave, as described in the listing. A French press is also available for coffee.
The listing clearly states the location in Central Harlem. As with many areas of New York City, it is an urban neighborhood with a wide range of realities, which may differ from individual expectations.
Thank you for your stay, and I wish you well in your future travels.

Minami
Torrance, California
Rating, 5 stars
,
¬∑
December 2025
,
¬∑
Stayed a few nights
It was the holiday season in December, and the yen was weak, so I had a hard time finding a place to stay for 4 nights, but this place is in a very convenient location within 15 minutes of Times Square and Grand Central Station, and despite being a Hilton, it was relatively reasonably priced, which was very helpful.
It was quiet at night, and there were many 7-Eleven, fast food stores, and restaurants in the area, so I had no trouble eating.
A fridge, safe, and hair dryer are also provided.
Although the air conditioner was a bit old, the room temperature was stable and we had a pleasant time.
You can also take an Uber in front of the hotel.
During our 4-night stay, the bathroom and sheets were cleaned daily, and we had a peaceful stay.
Breakfast is delicious and there is a service that bakes waffles.
The menu changes daily, but the omelet with vegetables, bacon, and cheese was especially delicious and my favorite.
Also, the host provided check-in instructions and messages about the trip, which made me feel warm.
The only thing that bothered me was the crowded elevator.
We stayed as a couple, but we were over capacity and had to wait a few times, and we were a little tired when we had to wait about 15 minutes to go down from the 16th floor to the 1st floor.
The employees use the same elevator as the guests, and I don't know if it was a malfunction or why, but it frequently stopped on floors where no one was there, and the wait time felt even longer that day.
I'm sorry to ask for a personal request, but I would appreciate it if you could avoid using the elevator for cleaning as much as possible during the busy breakfast hours (6:00-10:00).
During non-crowded hours, I was able to use it smoothly without any particular problems.
Apart from the above, it was a very pleasant stay overall.
I was able to leave my carry-on bag after check-out, so I was able to walk around the city for a few hours before going to the airport, and I really enjoyed my first trip to New York.

This AirB&B is for a hotel run by Hilton/Hampton group and not a home.  I've never stayed in Manhattan before, so for my experience, it was a great location.  We were able to walk to Times Square, our Theater, and Central Park.  There are loads of bars, eateries and shops all around, so never a lack for something to do.  It's a smaller space, so do not expect to have a place to sit other than the bed while having any downtime in the room.  Also, the shower door frame was out of alignment so the doors did not slide well and kept falling off the track (but not out of the channel).  Still, the room was clean, the staff friendly enough.  It was as quiet as one might expect in the middle of the city.  There was an option for parking, however it was double what I was able to find on SpotHero.  There is breakfast available and it's not bad, (though I recommend just eating in the city).  The problem is the dining area is small and the crowd was large.  All in all a great value and stay.

I was a bit nervous about staying outside of NYC since my plans were all there, but boy was I wrong. Commuting to and from the Port Authority Bus Terminal is very simple and fast. You also have the ferry option which is a bit more expensive but worth it if you want to avoid traffic or want a beautiful view of the skyline. And speaking of that, what an amazing view you get of the city once you hop off the bus in Weehawken!
Check in was smooth, bedroom was comfortable and shared bathroom was not a problem. Everything was clean and it almost felt we had the place to ourselves. 
A snowstorm hit NY when we arrived, so we had to change our plans a bit on the first day and stay in NJ, but there were great restaurants walking distance from the house. Thank you Willow

When I first entered the room, I found visible mold on the bed, which was disgusting and completely unacceptable from a health perspective. I asked to switch rooms, and while I was moved, the new room was barely functional:
	‚Ä¢	No working outlets (except in the bathroom)
	‚Ä¢	Only one working lamp
	‚Ä¢	TV didn‚Äôt turn on due to no power in the room
The hotel offered to move me yet again, but I had four large suitcases, and at that point I felt completely exhausted and unsupported. The staff was dismissive, unhelpful, and even borderline rude, making an already frustrating situation feel worse. I paid nearly $200 a night, which is outrageous given the poor conditions and lack of basic amenities.
I do not recommend this hotel. The rooms are poorly maintained, the service is lacking, and no one should have to deal with mold, non-functioning rooms, or being treated like an inconvenience.

Buenos Aires, Argentina

,

1 week ago
,

Stayed about a week
Very good experience. The location is one of the hotel's great strengths: it is meters from Fulton Station, which is huge and very practical. From there you can access several metro lines, which makes getting around the city really easy. In addition, the area feels very safe, even at night, something that was key for us.
As a nice touch, they kindly give you two bottles of water per day, which were picked up at the front desk. The hosts were always friendly and helpful.
The room is small, as is often the case in big cities, but very comforting. The bed, in particular, was very comfortable and allowed us to rest well every day.
Some days they also gave us cookies at the front desk, a simple gesture but it added a lot.
In short, a well-located hotel, in a safe area, with good service and details that make the stay more pleasant. No exaggeration, it's very good, and we definitely recommend it and would choose it again.
